item.title: 45cm x 75cm pothole., 22nd October
item.description:
Travelling down from Church Road into Kidnappers Lane. Below house called Green Acre, GL53 0NP, below blue cycle sign but before reach Lotts Meadow entrance. Hole on right hand side of road, full of water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Heart-shaped pothole near Coriander Drive on Innsworth Lane, 22nd October
item.description:
Related to FixMyStreet ref: 6544534 Now a lovely heart-shaped pothole, getting slightly bigger since I last raised this (see above ref). Northbound on Innsworth Lane, before NATO, near Coriander Drive. Could it be reviewed again please, and ideally filled ? Thinking about vehicle tyres, but also cyclists ! And commuters at dusk and night time ! Many thanks !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 359, Innsworth Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on Corinium Way which is a 50mph road, 22nd October
item.description:
Large pothole on the left lane, just past the Walls Factory on Corinium Way, with no safe way to avoid the pothole during busy hours. Large enough to cause severe damage to tyres/wheels.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Hucclecote, Gloucester

item.title: Traffic light timings on Kingsditch roundabout have changed, causing long tailbacks on Kingsditch Lane, 22nd October
item.description:
The traffic light timings on Kingsditch roundabout have changed. This is causing queues sometimes exceeding 1 mile, from before the railway bridge on Hyde Lane all the way to the roundabout. THE TIMINGS NEED CORRECTING URGENTLY.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.description:

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 22nd October
item.description:
Pothole repair fail. Disguised as a puddle by water. This is bad enough in a 4 wheeled vehicle, but could be much more unsafe if a bicycle or motorcycle hits this.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 22nd October
item.description:
Customer re-reporting damaged manhole cover. The tarmac around the manhole cover is badly damaged & moves when cars drive over it. The manhole cover is very noisy as it bangs whenever cars drive over it. This is frequently disturbing us during the day & is waking us during the night. Attached is a video that shows the tarmac moving. Please could the manhole cover be repaired asap? I reported the problem several weeks ago but nothing has been done & the damage & noise seems to be increasing.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned traffic cones and signs, 22nd October
item.description:
There are a number of abandoned cones and road signs outside my bungalow (9 Parkland Road) on the corner of Parkland Road and Highland Road. These have been there since 22 September when the pavement resurfacing work completed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Highland Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Steep ramp in pavement, 22nd October
item.description:
New Barn Lane, Cheltenham, S side pavement, By lamp post #18. 20metres from Broad Acre Road. The issue is that the developer of thge £b housing estate was allowed simply to join to the existing pavement with a steep ramp. This is really dangerous for poorly sighted people like me, and awkward for others. The pre-existing pavement has deteriorated to gravel! The section needs levelling out and re=surfacing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, New Barn Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: No cycling signs missing on footpath entrances, 22nd October
item.description:
The footpath that runs parallel to Mead Rd and between Mead Rd and the old railway line has four entrances, 2 on Mead Rd, one on Old Bath Rd and one coming from Treelands Drive. Though reported many months ago, only one no cycling sign has been put up, resulting in lots of people still cycling down the footpath endangering pedestrians. Could you please put no cycling signs up at all the entrances, then at least cyclists have been informed and shouldn’t be cycling on the footpath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenhills Close, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
